meanings.definition: Existing, happening, or done at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The two friends arrived at the party at concurrent times.
meanings.sent2: The meeting and the presentation were concurrent events.
meanings.sent3: It was a concurrent coincidence that they both wore the same outfit.
meanings.sent4: Their laughter was concurrent with the sound of fireworks in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The thunder and lightning were concurrent, creating a dramatic atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The concurrent efforts of the team led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent2: The concurrent departments worked together seamlessly to achieve the goal.
meanings.sent3: The cats showed concurrent teamwork in catching the mouse.
meanings.sent4: Their voices were concurrent in harmony, creating a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: The dancers moved with concurrent grace, mesmerizing the audience.
